metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6377 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in audio in Google Chrome prior to 79.0.3945.117 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0.3945.130-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
